hero.question: Will the DHS shutdown end after March 31, 2026?
hero.prob_take: The 10-point jump to 49% signals renewed confidence that Congress will actually fund the DHS before the deadline, likely driven by fresh polling showing shutdown fatigue or backroom deal signals that sharp traders caught before the crowd. At even odds, the market's pricing in too much chaos when historical precedent shows continuing resolutions pass routinely, making 55%+ the fair value if you believe gridlock gets resolved as it usually does.

daily_take.headline: DHS Shutdown Resolution Just Got 10 Points Cheaper, Here's Why That's Wrong
daily_take.deck: The odds on ending the DHS shutdown after March 31, 2026 jumped from 39% to 49% in 24 hours, pricing in a sudden wave of optimism about congressional negotiations. But the math doesn't match the move. Congress has shown zero ability to break this deadlock, and March 31 gives them only 10 weeks to act. Smart money fades the spike and shorts the resolution narrative.

sidebar.headline: CDU's seat dominance collapsed 27 points in one day, suggesting late polling shifts or market overconfidence in their regional machine.
